sub_title: Mathematics Analyst II at GLI Europe B.V.
summary:
I live in Amsterdam Noord and I currently work as a software developer and data analyst at Gaming Laboratories International (European office, in Haarlem). I have traveled for work with this company and that is something I always gladly do. I also really enjoy remote working, whenever my position allows it.

My usual day at work:
-> Development of source code for testing math models mostly using C++ and Python.
-> Review of source code from our clients, in many different programming languages.
-> Analysis of complex analytical math models in Excel and their respective technical documentation.
-> Probabilistic analysis and advanced slot game statistical and jurisdictional/compliance testing.
-> Generation of data pipelines for the collection of data/inputs.
-> Coding of Monte Carlo simulations and statistical analysis of big volumes of data/results.
-> Compile of results in detailed Excel reports and internal deliverables.
-> Communications with clients about the testing and compliance issues of their products.
-> Presentation of the results of our data analysis to our internal and external stakeholders.
-> Source code review and statistical testing of random number generators.

On top of that, I also do:
-> Peer review and debugging of the projects of my colleagues.
-> Workload and task management within my team.
-> Participation in the improvement of our internal tools and source code base.
-> Supervision of all the math projects/tasks/issues from one of our major clients.
-> Technical and administrative training of new hires.
-> Scoping and assignment of new tasks and projects.
-> Participation in process and workflow improvement discussions.
-> Organization and preparation of training sessions with our clients.
-> Bridging different teams from different locations within the department.

I am very passionate and experienced about programming of pipelines for data organization, extraction and processing. My education in physics and math made me very thorough and detailed. It also gave me sharp critical thinking and a problem solving oriented mind. I consider that I have very good data analysis, graphical display and communication/reporting skills. I always produce high quality deliverables with attention to detail. I love both learning and teaching, which gives me great teamwork skills.

I am a quick learner: I have already worked in two departments at this company and both times I learned everything on the job within weeks of starting. I am also willing to study on top of my working hours, to minimize on-boarding time and smooth out the learning curve.

profile_positions.description:
Main Tasks:
-> Development of source code for testing math models mostly using C++ and Python.
-> Review of source code from our clients (in many different programming languages).
-> Analysis of complex analytical math models in Excel and their respective technical documentation.
-> Carrying out statistical and probabilistic analysis (both analytically and numerically).
-> Testing of advanced slot games, both from a statistical and a jurisdictional/compliance point of view.
-> Generation of data pipelines for the collection of data/inputs.
-> Generation of Monte Carlo simulations.
-> Statistical analysis of big volumes of data/results.
-> Compilation of detailed Excel reports with the results of the data analysis for presentation to internal and external stakeholders.

Additional Tasks:
-> Peer review, technical validation and debugging of my colleagues' projects.
-> Managing the department's workload and project queue, as well as my team's specific tasks.
-> Participation in the improvement of our internal tools and source code base.
-> Management of all the math projects/tasks/issues from one of our major clients.
-> Preparing and carrying out the technical training of new hires.
-> Scoping and assigning new projects to the team (project management and project lead).
-> Participation in process and workflow improvement discussions.
-> Organization of training sessions with our clients.
-> Bridging different teams (from different locations) within the math/data analysis department.

I have traveled for work with this company and that is something I always gladly accept to do.
profile_positions.title: Mathematics Analyst II

profile_positions.description:
Main Tasks:
-> Preparation of testing plans (jurisdictional/regulatory and quality).
-> Testing of software/hardware for physical gambling platforms/systems, as well as software for iGaming.
-> Reviewing of clients' source code, game documentation and game functionality.
-> Ensure the tested games show the described and expected behavior at all times.
-> Ensure clarity and unambiguity in all game rules, leaving no space for disputes or misinterpretations.
-> Reviewing the available prize tables and testing all software configuration options.
-> Testing for compliance and validating products against applicable jurisdictional specifications.
-> Preparation of compliance and certification reports.

Additional Tasks:
-> Evaluate eventual conditions on the approval of each tested product.
-> Gathering of data to assist the other departments (QA, math and compliance) in their analysis.
-> Assisting the senior engineers with the project and workload management.
-> Distribution and management of projects and tasks.
-> Technical and administrative training of new hires.
-> Reviewing tasks and projects completed by other engineers.
-> Assisting with the testing of casino surveillance/accounting systems.
profile_positions.title: Test Engineer II

company.name: Red Light Secrets - Museum of Prostitution

profile_positions.company: Red Light Secrets - Museum of Prostitution
profile_positions.description:
Main Tasks:
-> Marketing the museum and experience at the door.
-> Selling tickets and validating vouchers at the museum entrance.
-> Reception of the visitors with a brief introduction to the history of prostitution in the city/country.
-> Organizing the stock of the merchandising handed in at the entrance and sold at the museum shop.
-> Selling merchandising products at the museum shop.
-> Performing the daily accounting reports at the beginning and at the end of each shift.

Additional Tasks:
-> Carrying out an introduction to the visitors about the museum and its origin, context and purpose.
-> Maintenance of the museum premises and its different exhibits/rooms.
-> Collecting the visitors’ feedback at the museum shop.
profile_positions.title: Museum Assistant

company.name: MAAT: Museu de Arte, Arquitetura e Tecnologia

profile_positions.company: MAAT: Museu de Arte, Arquitetura e Tecnologia
profile_positions.description:
Guided tours and visitors support (at the former Museu da Eletricidade - Central Tejo).

Main Tasks:
-> Performing guided tours to the museum, with both historical and scientific/technological content.
-> Introduction of the building as the former coal-fired power station - the first ever in Lisbon.
-> Assisting visitors during their visit to the museum.
-> Organizing and performing educational workshops about electromagnetism and energy production.
-> Giving presentations to children and teenagers of different ages about the history of electricity.

Additional Tasks:
-> Design and adaptation of the available activities and guided tours to the different groups of visitors.
-> Assisting the arts team with their projects, installations and tours.
-> Selling tickets and validating vouchers at the museum entrance.
-> Organizing the stock of the merchandising handed in at the entrance and sold at the museum shop.
-> Selling merchandising products and collecting the visitors’ feedback at the museum shop.
-> Maintenance of the museum premises and its different exhibits/rooms.
profile_positions.title: Museum Assistant

company.name: Instituto de Astrofísica e Ciências do Espaço

volunteer_experiences.description:
-> Participating in the organization and preparation of this open, free outreach event.
-> Carrying out the reception of the visitors to the monthly activities.
-> Setting up the available telescopes for the visitors to observe and analysis different types of object.
-> Explaining the observable objects to the visitors: Moon, planets in the Solar System, stars and clusters.
-> Providing data related to Astronomy and Astrophysics and their latest developments to the visitors.
-> Answering visitors' questions about the activities and the other projects/initiatives of the Institute.
